snippet: The new government of Ukraine accused Russia of deploying 16,000 troops to Crimean Peninsula and demanding that it surrender or face armed assault — a claim Russia denied.
abstract: Embattled new government of Ukraine accuses Russian forces of a major escalation in military pressure over control of the Crimean Peninsula; says Russia has deployed 16,000 troops in the region and has demanded that Ukrainian forces surrender or face armed assault, claim Russia has denied.

byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER and DAVID M. HERSZENHORN
byline.contributor: Steven Erlanger reported from Kiev, and David M. Herszenhorn from Sevastopol, Ukraine. Somini Sengupta contributed reporting from the United Nations.

lead_paragraph: The new government of Ukraine accused Russia of deploying 16,000 troops to Crimean Peninsula and demanding that it surrender or face armed assault — a claim Russia denied.

headline.main: Kiev Cites Campaign of Pressure by Russia
headline.print_headline: Kiev Cites Campaign of Pressure by Russia
